newsitem.title: SWEDEN: SWIMMING-GOUKOV WINS MEN'S 200 BREASTROKE WORLD TITLE.
newsitem.headline: SWIMMING-GOUKOV WINS MEN'S 200 BREASTROKE WORLD TITLE.

text.p: Alexander Goukov put Belarus among the gold medallists at the world short-course swimming championships with a last-gasp win in the men's 200 metres breaststroke on Saturday.
Goukov, who won the European short-course title in Rostock last December, grabbed the gold in a tremendous duel with Russia's Andrei Korneev down the final length of the eight-length race.
Olympic bronze medallist Korneev had taken the lead before the halfway mark and looked the likely winner as the race progressed.
But Goukov had other ideas and pipped the Russian by 0.03 of a second in two minutes 9.25 seconds.
Korneev took the silver and Germany's Jens Kruppa the bronze in 2:10.53, just 0.05 seconds ahead of another Russian, Stanislav Lopukhov.
Korneev was initially stripped of his medal at last year's Atlanta Olympics after taking the bronze in the 200 breaststroke for testing positive for the stimulant-cum-masking agent bromantan.
But the Russian was subsequently reinstated after the Court of Arbitration (CAS), a world sports tribunal, overturned the International Olympic Committee's ban.
The CAS said it had not been proven that bromantan was a stimulant to a standard sufficient to justify such a harsh punishment.
